results.title: London lock-down to cost £10bn a month
results.summary: A London lock-down for a month could cost £10bn, reckons the Centre for Economics and Business Research.

results.title: New York governor: We have "no plan whatsoever" to quarantine New York City
results.summary: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said there are no plans to quarantine New York City, despite rumors and fears.

results.title: BBC's Question Time to lose studio audience
results.summary: Question Time, the BBC's flagship political debate programme, will proceed without an audience during the coronavirus outbreak.

results.title: Laura Ashley collapses as firms demand more help
results.summary: Fashion and furniture chain Laura Ashley has become the latest business casualty of the coronavirus pandemic.

results.title: Royal Bath and West show postponed
results.summary: Following the Government guidance, we have made the extremely difficult decision to postpone the Royal Bath & West Show. The Royal Bath & West Show will now take place on 31st July, 1st & 2nd August

results.title: Atlanta airport closes two domestic terminal checkpoints due to "declining demand"
results.summary: Hartsfield Jackson International Airport has temporarily closed the north and south domestic terminal checkpoints due to "declining demand," according to airport spokesperson, Elise Durham.

results.title: Second death in Scotland from coronavirus
results.summary: A second person has died in Scotland after becoming infected with coronavirus, the Scottish government says.

results.title: Brooklyn will stop prosecuting "low-level offenses that don't jeopardize public safety"
results.summary: The Brooklyn, New York, district attorney's office says it will stop prosecuting “low-level offenses that don’t jeopardize public safety.”

results.title: Alan Partridge festival postponed over coronavirus
results.summary: The organiser of an Alan Partridge fan festival has decided not to take a chance with people's health - and postponed the event.

results.title: NI schools 'should close immediately'
results.summary: Schools in NI should close immediately, an umbrella body for Catholic school principals has said.
